list_definition.definition: to treat (a person’s body or part of it) by rubbing etc to ease and remove pain or stiffness

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His ankle was treated by massage.

list_ex_of_english: They may use that terminology but there cannot be massaging of notified vacancies.
They do not have that effect, and the more that they appear to be massaged, the less they inspire confidence, because people have long since given up believing ministerial forecasts.
The figures are then massaged and sent down like darts to the county councils.
The two sets of figures are massaged into compatibility by the forecast that the income from council house sales will rise by £430 million next year.
At least the total of one million unemployed then was a real figure and not a massaged figure.
Is not the wide talk of profits for companies now largely fiction and a matter of opinion, with figures being massaged by standard accountancy techniques?
If the foreign policy baseline is not published here, on the official record, it can always be massaged to fit the budgetary restraints.
We were here in the 1980s when, by managing and massaging our activities, we got by.
